sense.name: 外, outside
sense.commentary: Not within or part of something.
sense.examples:
国外 outside the country
校外 outside the school
她发现大商场外有很多好衣服. Outside of a department store, she had never seen so many lovely clothes.

sense.name: 外, other
sense.commentary: The second of two things or people, or the item or person that is left from a group or ret of things.
sense.examples:
外省 Other provinces.
外县 Other country
外来干部 Cadre transferred from other place.

sense.name: 外, foreign, external, ancient
sense.commentary: Belonging or connected to a country that is not your own or is not the one you are in.
sense.examples:
外商 Foreign merchants.
对外贸易 Trade with foreign countries.
古今中外 Modern or ancient times.

sense.name: 外, (relatives) of one's mother, sisters or daughters
sense.commentary: On one's mother's, sister's or daughter's side.
sense.examples:
外甥 Daughter's son.
外甥儿 Sister's son.
外甥女 Sister's daughter.

sense.name: 外, not of the same organization, class, etc, not closely related,
sense.commentary: Not closely related people or items.
sense.examples:
外客 A guest who is not a relative.
外人 a stranger
你太见外了. You regarded me as an outsider.

sense.name: 外, besides, extra, in addition, beyond,
sense.commentary: added, additional, or more than expected.
sense.examples:
预算外的开资。 extra-budgetary expenditure.
除了音响外,我们的新车没有另外东西. We didn't get any extras on our new car excfept for the CD player.
他每天工作外加两小时. He's been working an extra two hours a day.

sense.name: 外, 非官方, 民间, unofficial,
sense.commentary: not connected with or coming from a recognized office or authority.
sense.examples:
外传 Unofficial biography.
我们把他看作非官方地方学家. We think of him as the unofficial town historian.
民间往来 the unofficial exchanges.
